alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:38PM EST until December 28 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County. For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by midnight tonight to a crest of 14.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (11 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date White Clay Creek Newark 13.0 8.6 Wed 10 p 5.5 MSG 14.1 2am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1030 AM EST.
